name: Openstart
description: Openstart is a vehicle rental platform offering monthly, all-in car subscriptions to customers who want to drive for ridehailing platforms such as Ola, ViaVan, Citymapper and Uber. Our mission is to establish ourselves as the go-to platform for the entire industry all over, starting in the UK.

jobs.title: Operations Administrator
jobs.description:
THE ROLE

The Operations Administrator is responsible for assisting and closing qualified leads that are passed through our online website. You’ll be intermingling across various responsibilities to start with, establishing yourself as a key port of contact within our team. Does the idea of working at a fast-paced, competitive environment sound like an exciting challenge for you? If yes, then Openstart might be the place for you!

WHAT YOU’LL DO

• Nurture and close warm leads through high volume outbound calls (50+ calls/day – no cold calls) and via live chat.
• Consult with the clients to assess their needs and offer subscription options which solve their car needs
• Spend time converting enquiries into customers, whilst liaising with supply partners for the vehicle you require.
• Running the tech platform, making sure it is 110% accurate and up-to-date on a daily basis.

REQUIREMENTS
• Grads Welcome (2:1 degree preferable)

• Experience selling over the phone

• Understanding of, or experience in, dealing with customers on a daily basis.

BENEFITS
A competitive salary between £21-24k depending  on experience.
25 days’ holiday plus all bank holidays
Pension scheme

This is a unique opportunity to get involved in a startup from the ground up. Currently based in W5 but will be relocating to the West End within 6 months!

jobs.title: Credit Control/Online Administrator
jobs.description:
Openstart is a vehicle rental platform offering monthly, all-in car subscriptions to customers who want to drive for ridehailing platforms such as Ola, ViaVan, Citymapper and Uber. Our mission is to establish ourselves as the go-to platform for the entire industry all over, starting in the UK.

THE ROLE

The Financial Controller is responsible for the financial side of the day-to-day operations. This includes:

(Mostly) Making sure our weekly subscribers are paying on time.
Making sure any additional expenses are paid.
Setting up payment plans with any debtors.
Processing refunds, issuing credit notes and monitoring all payments.
Taking debtors to small claims court if needs be.
Assisting with the daily phone calls
When you have time spare, you will also be part of the online admin/growth team:

Consult with the clients to assess their needs and offer subscription options which solve their car needs
Nurture and close warm leads through high volume outbound calls and via live chat.
Spend time converting enquiries into customers, whilst liaising with supply partners for the vehicle you require.
Working on the tech platform alongside the whole team.
REQUIREMENTS
• Grads Welcome (2:1 degree preferable)

• Experience in credit control

• Understanding of, or experience in, dealing with customers on a daily basis.

KEY QUALITIES:
• Patience, and a passion for the company
• Able to build and maintain amicable relationships with subscribers.
• Able to cope in a very fast-paced environment
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills

BENEFITS
A competitive salary between £21-24k depending  on credit control experience.
25 days’ holiday plus all bank holidays
Pension scheme
